DOC.brief_summary: The investigator propose use Natural Language Processing System ( NLP ) provide initial baseline report primary care patient risk diabetes cardiovascular complication include : ) evidence foot exam documentation previous year ; b ) use aspirin cardiovascular risk reduction ; c ) tobacco use . As part randomize trial , plan use previously validate mail survey ( NCQA Provider Recognition Program ) request information last foot exam , use aspirin tobacco . Patients identify NLP foot exam randomize treatment control arm . Both arm receive informational letter ; second mailing nonresponders one month , describe key strategy effective patient-physician communication clinical encounter . The treatment arm also receive informational letter patient education brochure contain key message importance regular foot examination . NLP repeat 6 month compare impact patient education material .
DOC.brief_title: Natural Language Processing Quality Assessment Primary Care
DOC.criteria: primary care patient diagnosis diabetes unwilling give inform consent
